sentences.en: A benevolent uncle paid for her to have music lessons.
sentences.cn: 一位叔叔慷慨解囊，出钱供她上音乐课。

sentences.en: Capitalists are never benevolent to workers.
sentences.cn: 资本家对工人从来不乐善好施.

sentences.en: Dr. Middleton balanced himself, and with an air of benevolent slyness.
sentences.cn: 弥得尔顿博士以慈悲为怀的神气闪烁其辞地把话又说回来.

sentences.en: For the first few hours he would feel happy and benevolent.
sentences.cn: 开头只觉得心里快活、热乎.

sentences.en: He is always benevolent towards his countryman.
sentences.cn: 他对同胞总是善悲为怀.

sentences.en: He is benevolent to [ toward ] old people.
sentences.cn: 他对老人极为 亲切.

sentences.en: He possesses a mild and benevolent countenance.
His smooth, speculative face is composed to benevolent expectation.
sentences.cn: 他那张光滑而沉思的脸露出助人为乐的慈祥神色.

sentences.en: Our teachers taught us to be benevolent.
sentences.cn: 我们的老师教导我们应当以仁慈为怀.

sentences.en: Primo de Rivera himself was a benevolent and sincere paternalist.
sentences.cn: 普里莫·德里韦拉本人是个仁慈而真诚的家长式人物。

sentences.en: The clerk regarded him with benevolent amusement.
sentences.cn: 这个职员好心而又饶有兴趣地看着他。

sentences.en: The rich are not benevolent ; the benevolent are not rich.
The trustee, as such, is fat and pompous and benevolent.
sentences.cn: 所谓理事, 应当肥胖,傲慢,一副慈善模样.

sentences.en: Their benevolent disposition often made them enter the cottages of the poor.
sentences.cn: 乐善好施的天性、常常驱使他们走访贫苦村民的茅舍.

sentences.en: We could count on benevolent understanding.
sentences.cn: 我们可以指望得到善意的谅解.
